Comprehensive & Accessible Button System

A complete specification for all button types and states in the LawnQuote Design System.

The Core Problem: Inconsistent & Inaccessible Buttons

The initial implementation uses color combinations that fail accessibility standards, creating a poor user experience. This demonstrates the specific contrast failure.

Contrast: 2.7:1 (Fails AAA)

(#F2B705 on #FFFFFF)

1. Primary Buttons

For the most important actions on a page, like submitting a form or confirming a purchase.

Default

Contrast: 14.8:1 (Passes AAA)

Hover

Disabled

Contrast: 4.6:1 (Passes AA)

2. Secondary Buttons

For actions that are important but not the primary focus. This "ghost" style is versatile and avoids color contrast issues.

Default

Contrast: 13.1:1 (Passes AAA)

Hover

Disabled

3. Accent / Call-to-Action Buttons

Use sparingly to draw attention to a key action, like "Add to Cart" or creating a new item. MUST use dark text for accessibility.

Default

Contrast: 10.2:1 (Passes AAA)

Hover

Disabled

Contrast: 4.6:1 (Passes AA)

4. Destructive Buttons

For actions that result in data loss, like deleting an item. The red color signals caution.

Default

Contrast: 4.5:1 (Passes AA)

Hover

Disabled
